titleStmt.title: Christian von Hesse to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2018

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
Christian von Hesse,
Attorney & Counsellor. Notary Public.
39 Nassau Street, New York, Jan. 16. 1865

To his Excellency
Thos. E Bramlette
Governor of the State of Kentucky
I hereby apply to your Excellency to appoint me a Commissioner for the State of Kentucky residing in the KenCity of New York

I have the honor to remain
Your Excellencys
most obedient servant
Christian von Hesse

Mr Von Hesse is highly
recommended to me by my friend Mr Hall of New York City

R E Fenton
Governor of N. Y.

Comr Deeds
Christian von Jesse
New York
apptd 9th Feby 1865
